title: Martha!
text: Like many my age, I enjoyed the original Jumanji when it first came out, and I even watched the animated show that followed as well. I always felt my memories of Jumanji were actually better than it was though, and even now I can't remember a whole lot about it.What I can remember though is that Welcome to the Jungle picks up from the original's cliffhanger; with the board game washing up on the beach, and claiming it's first victim in it's new video game guise to act as this movies Alan Parrish. Fast forward twenty years to the present day and we're introduced to a varied, if slightly cliché, group of high schoolers. During detention, they find the video game, plug it in, and get sucked into the world of Jumanji, updated for the video game generation.What follows is like an amalgamation of Breakfast Club, Freaky Friday, and Tropic Thunder. Each teenager is put into a new body, in a game character who holds a completely new role for them to play than they do in their lives. The two popular/athletic kids are stuck in brainy, physically-diminished bodies, while the two nerds are stuck in attractive, athletic bodies. Many of the jokes hinge on these body swaps, and while you can see where these jokes go before they even happen, they still manage to feel fresh and funny. Seeing Dwayne Johnson play an awkward, jumpy kid is always funny. Always.On that note, the core cast are pretty great on the whole, which actually really surprised me. At no point did I watch them and think 'oh hey that's Dwayne Johnson being goofy'. Instead they managed to capture the essence of being a teenager perfectly to the point that I still considered them teenagers, as if some sort of acting voodoo had occured that literally swapped the body's of the actors. Barring Kevin Hart, who literally just plays Kevin Hart the whole time. But Karen Gillan fits snug in the nerdy, socially awkward character of Martha so effortlessly that she even keeps the character going when she's just in the background and not the main focus. She also has a surprising amount of comedy chops too. Seeing her attempt and fail to flirt and be sexy is worth the price of admission alone. (And on the note of her outfit, it's a video game, that's the entire point)That said Jack Black steals the show as Bethany. While sometimes he can find it hard to break free of being himself, at other times he can be truly transformative, and Welcome to the Jungle is one of those times. He's not Jack Black here, he's a teenage white girl obsessed with her phone and her looks. The way he marvels at being able to pee standing up, or teaching Martha how to flirt, or giving Nick Jonas mouth-to-mouth, or staring at Dwayne Johnson wide-eyed and gushing. He really channels his inner teenage girl so well that's hard to take him any other way. He steals the show. Of course it helps that Bethany becomes one of the best developed characters in the entire movie. She starts out stereotypically self-absorbed, and almost cringeworthy in her obsession with selfies and instagram. But as the movie develops we see new sides to her. Away from her phone, she's understanding and smart, and at no point is she played as a ditsy blonde that this kind of movie would fall back on for jokes.The character of Bethany is more of an exception than the rule when it comes to character development though. Martha and Spencer enjoy a little bit from being put in attractive, athletic bodies for once, and the newfound confidences that brings, but otherwise they come out the other end the same nerdy teenagers they were before. Fridge is even worse. He's a terrible human being throughout the entire movie until the coda where they're all suddenly best friends. The villain is horrifically underutilised as well. He's a snarling, one-dimensional villain without motivations, put in there just to give a human antagonist to fight against. I wouldn't be surprised if Bobby Cannavale wasn't happy with how his character turned out in the end.Humour is top-notch and is the movie's sole reason for existence. It makes it not only bearable, but genuinely enjoyable to watch. It takes it's jokes from a variety of genres, from slapstick, to wit, to the whole body swap thing, but never relies on cringe or gross-out moments. It also manages to keep its humourous tone consistent throughout, never getting too serious, or conversely making light of more serious moments.Of course what this does mean is that Welcome to the Jungle does not feel like Jumanji at all. It's a fun adventure romp with teenagers body-swapping into a jungle game. The opening with the recreated cliffhanger from the original, and even a name-drop or two of Alan Parrish are all well and good, but they don't alter the fact that Welcome to the Jungle completely lacks any of the scares or fantasy established in that first film. There's no mutant animals or plants at all, and the tone is consistently light and upbeat, opting for surface entertainment than taking the opportunity to explore something deeper. The introduction of each character having three lives is smart, but it takes out much of the threat and danger of the place.Another minor niggle is the overabundance of needless CGI to create stunts and interesting fight choreography. I'm not usually one to complain about the use of CGI, but here it really stands out, enough to break the immersion and make you realise you are actually watching a movie. The music as well is super bland, and almost dated. Maybe that's deliberate to harken back to the original, but for such a modern re-telling it feels out-of-place and a little cheesy.In all Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is the definition of a safe family movie. It doesn't attempt to break any moulds or try anything new, and in fact shirks the tone of the franchise entirely just to keep it all feeling a little more vanilla. That said, and this is crucial, it's a movie that knows exactly what it is. It's cheap, surface-level entertainment, and in that is a rip-roaring success. It drags you into the world of these teenagers, never breaks character, and will keep you smiling and laughing from beginning to end. I cannot say that I had a terrible time or that I didn't like the movie, because despite being aimed at the lowest common denominator, it does it so well that I got sucked in just like everyone else. I give it an enjoyable 7/10.

title: Okay types.
text: If you are going to watch this movie expecting to be on lines of Jumanji-1, then you will be disappointed. Compared to the part-1, this movie is nothing. title: Fun film for the Family
text: Not sure what to expect, I went into Jumanji with an open mind. I'm not a huge fan of the original, so was interest in what was in store.This film is definitely action/comedy rather than just action, as the writing seems to treat both aspects with equal importance. The gags are generally funny, but can get too much at times as the film seems to loose focus. Anyone looking for constant action may be disappointed.The characters seem to be chosen to empower various young stereotypes, which can only be a good thing. However, for adults watching alone it may be slightly annoying. Welcome to the Jungle is worth a watch for anyone who enjoys a lighthearted blockbuster type adventure.

title: Absolutely hilarious, perfectly cast
text: Loved the movie and watched it three times already. Very well made, very funny, light and entertaining. Jack Black is a highlight.

title: A Family friendly film
text:
Jumanji is one of those movies that you must watch every single time it comes on TV. It doesn't matter how old I am, or what I'm doing, Jumanji is getting watched! Robin Williams performance in the film was phenomenal, and personally, one of my favorites. This being said, I was very weary about the new Jumanji coming out. I knew for sure thy would ruin it. No way could they compete with the modern classic!! 22 years later & all I could gather up were low expectations and mild interests.
However, given my low enthusiasm of this film, I was pleasantly surprised by how "fun" the movie is. The movie theatre actually filled with laughter (mine included). You couldn't help but smile your way through it. Given the all the components (Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart, and Jack Black) comedy is sure to ensue. And let's face it...anytime Kevin & Dwayne do anything on screen together, I don't care what it is, I'm there.Unfortunately, I will say that Kevin Hart is exactly that in this movie, Kevin Hart. We all know his humor, and to be honest it is getting sort of old and routine. His comedic style is very predictable and sometimes overdone. Jack Black (Bethany) delivers a great performance with his rendition of a white teenage girl that will have you laughing the whole way through. His one-liners kept a smile on my face the whole movie, and surprisingly he became my favorite character.
Going into this movie, I had to keep reminding myself that it is not, by any means, a remake of the original. There were very scarce similarities, and I found that as an upside. I loved the fact that the film tried to stand on its own. They weren't trying to recreate and redo this classic that they could potentially ruin. Going in with an open mind really helped me enjoy this new Jumanji film. It delivers a continuation of the film with some major modern updates for the 2000 generation.
"Jumanji" (1995) was thrilling and chilling. You're lying if you say you weren't terrified of those humongous spiders or Van Pelt with his shotgun. "In the jungle you must wait, until the dice read 5 or 8" was my constant reminder to NEVER play Jumanji, even if the board game was bought at the nearest Walmart. However, "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle," was not scary or thrilling at all. It definitely is more comedic than adventurous, which depending on your preferred genre, may be a plus or negative to you.
It is definitely a great film for the family to see together right around the holidays, just don't count on any Oscar nominations any time soon 😊

title: Moderately Diverting
text: Moderately entertaining film that I probably would never have bothered watching had I not been on an 8-hour flight with slim pickings for entertainment options.Dwayne Johnson tries his hand at outright comedy and does a pretty decent job at it. He and Karen Gillan are the film's highlights, since they're the only ones who try to actually act, playing game avatar versions of awkward teenagers. Much as I like Jack Black normally, he's pretty wasted in his role, and Kevin Hart works overtime to wring laughs out of the script but didn't make me chuckle once. The less said about Bobby Cannavale's performance as the movie's villain the better. I know this movie takes place in a video game world and that an element of exaggeration is fine, but come on. He's nearly unwatchable.Grade: B-

title: Surprisingly Good
text: It's hard to top a Robin Williams film with a sequel that doesn't feature Robin Williams, but this Jumanji does its own thing while still remaining true to the original. This one takes place in a video game and not a board game and as a gamer I absolutely loved all the gaming references throughout the film. It was a great cast and I was surprised how well Bobby Cannavale could play a over the top villain, just like the ones you find in old video games. All in all, I was pleasantly surprised by Jumanji and would definitely watch it again.

title: Better than Expected
text: I took my 10yo son and his friends to see this movie long after it opened and have to say it was a ton of fun. I expected a regurgitated rendition of Robin William's adventure but this was a character driven movie about realizing who you are and who you want to be. We all laughed out loud, jumped in surprise a few times and left the theatre feeling happy. What more can you ask for in a comedy? I am not sure of it's PG13 rating, being that I was there with other people's children I tried to be very aware of situational issues, language etc. and beyond a few jokes about male genetalia, it was relatively tame. Kevin Hart was awesome, the whole cast was awesome and the tiny nod to Alan Parish from the first movie was sweet. Very well done guys.

title: It's fun if you don't play the comparison game.
text:
Of course the old movie is really good, no doubt about that. It way more classy. And come on it's Robin Williams.
It's hard to do something new with a title like this. Handling it like a video game rather than board game was a good change of pace.
To be honest, if you treat this movie as an entity of it's own and watch it with an open mind I'm sure you'll have fun.

title: Tons of laughs and a solid tribute to the late/great Robin Williams
text: My wife and I got to see an early screening of this movie. We went in with low expectations because of how much we loved the first one. WOW were we blown away. The comedy is top notch and honestly Jack Black steals the show. There were a 2 or 3 jokes I didn't think should be in the movie because younger kids will be watching. Other than that the action, comedy, and story are all top notch. Go check it out.

title: Average but worth a watch
text: In my book the new iteration of Jumanji is your average adventure movie. It has thrills, humour, and tries to tell you something about life. It remains a popcorn flick but for anyone who wants to watch a movie that will fade away after a day or two, but still offers enough enjoyment for an evening, Jumanji gives you just that. Featuring three of the funniest guys in Hollywood and one talented hot chick (and one of brothers Jonas) the movie remains approachable and well-paced throughout. There is a framework for character development but as expected it is forced and basic as hell. I would still watch the original from '95 but for modern audiences this would likely becomes the go to film in the 'franchise'. There will be likely another one based on the huge money it earned so far.

title: Amazing !
text: I loved this movie, so epic ! you guys must watch it !

title: This is how you make a reboot: fun and entertaining!
text: It's fun, action-packed, cute and overall very entertaining. Now THAT'S how you make a reboot!

title: the movie was really nice but it really didn't have to exist!!

title: Well done but nothing like the 95' version
text: Just a nod to Robin Williams and his amazing work with single handedly carrying this franchise to this point in time.

title: Nice
text: Normal and entertaining movie suitable for the whole family. Not too good but not too bad, just nice.

title: Welcome to the sequel
text: The phrase says do not judge a book by its cover and well here is not judge a movie for his trailer, the film is good and no, it is not better than the original, but if it works as a sequel and it is quite funny the director Jake Kasdan managed to make a good combination between action and comedy and although there are several jokes about male reproductive organs (apparently the fashion joke this 2017) but the interesting thing is the great chemistry that exists between the actors Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson was very funny to see him perform in a different way gave a certain charisma to his character,ack Black no doubt takes the movie his humor is excellent and goes according to the situation,Kevin Hart funny situations that make you like,Karen Gillan gives touches of action and sympathy,even Nick Jonas did well his role,but if he has his bad side the movie, the rules of the game in original base sometimes they do not make sense and you take a lot of freedom with these rules, other thing is we see all the time that idea in cartoons and movies(Dungeons and Dragons and The Thirteenth Floor)out of that I think the movie works, it's fun, it's entertaining, perfect for the season, I take out a tear that reference to Alan Parrish his legacy is intact.

title: Predictable but solid storyline, it's fun and does the job really well.
text: Just don't expect original wrinting, and you'll have a very good time with this movie.

title: Better than I expected
text: Movies about video games have the worst rep in movie history. Add to that this being a sequel and has Jack Black in it as a teenage girl... yeah I was expecting something intolerable with it.It starts off lame as expected. A bunch of walking stereotypes all get a contrived reason to have detention together where they find the game and start playing. This leads to the first continuity error of the movie, The game turned into a gaming cartilage when the 90's kid ignored it at first. kindda off it's version of keeping up with the times. When the other kids come across it, it's a console.make no mistake the first 15-20 minutes of this drag like hell. once they're in the game however it's a 180. I totally buy that they are avatars of those same teens. the "game" is very straight forward and easy to grasp from the get go with the movie being more about the character's development then anything else. They started off paper thin but the movie played it up nicely, the visuals were fun and... I can't believe I'm saying this but Jack Black was actually funny in this!There is a tie in with the original but it's subtle and I liked how the ending was faithful to how the original ended. This was fun movie for the family. it started at ground zero but made you care about the characters and get invested in it as it went on. 8.5 stars and a recommendation from me.

title: A Solid, Fun Film
text: I wasn't expecting a whole lot from this movie. I was expecting something like "Journey to the Center of the Earth" and all its cheesiness. And I was expecting something trying to profit off of the original, beloved Jumanji movie. But this was actually a very good movie! It was fun, made sense, and was exciting. The plot wasn't deep or surprising but there is a lot of cleverness to it! The acting was great, and the jokes were funny too. I would recommend it!

title: Surprised!
text: Was wondering how a sequel would fare to this unusual original, but they did a great job. great cast complimented the script well. Good humor stuck in perfect places, good action. Everything seemed to flow very well and the cast gelled together like few others. Enjoyed watching this from front to back and not any real dull moments where a viewer would just sigh and hit the "stop" button or fast forward. Well done :)

title: Pretty fun movie
text: First off, I am glad that this movie didn't try to reboot or ignore it's predecessor, but it didn't force feed us references and cameos (cough Ghostbusters cough). That is very much appreciated. Second off, even though it never would have happened, Jack Black legitimately deserved an Oscar nomination for this movie. Never for a second did I not believe he was a teenage girl. He does so much more than just play on the stereotypes as well. Mr. Black gives Bethany a proper character arc, using subtle humor. He is the best part of the movie by miles. On that note, the movie does an impressive job of depicting high schoolers realistically, even if they are trapped in the bodies of video game avatars. Another performance that wowed me was Karen Gillen. I've been a fan of hers since Doctor Who and I was incredibly pleased to see her do such a great job with her character, a fun little play on the stereotypical video game female. If I had to pick a cast member I wasn't pleased with, it was Kevin Hart. He didn't seem to put as much effort into his character as the rest of the cast. It would have been better if they would have cast an actor who doesn't act the same in every movie, one who could've given a more talented performance. I also found that character rather weak. And Nick Jonas... sigh. The villain was fine. Nothing special. The introduction of his character felt really unnecessary and forced. I do wish the movie had gone a little farther with its parody of video games. It introduces fun concepts, like the cutscene, but doesn't really run with it enough to make it as fun as it could be. All in all a flawed, but ultimately fun and funny movie, even if a few jokes don't land.

title: It is what it is !
text: Saw it . Liked all the actors. It was ok but I would not recommend it. It is what it is , corny and a little funny !

title: Fun and Fun

title: Good sequel

There's a lot of solid idea's here, but it can't maintain the long duration. The film was respectful, but they make an odd choice to have the teens remember the game. In the original Dunsts character and her brother don't remember the game. Small annoyance against a fun sequel, but I hate these things. This film has energy and is a good time.

title: An impressive and fun sequel
text:
Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle 
2017Fun movie. I was impressed. Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson has come along way over the years. At the beginning of his acting career I really didn't like The Rock. Perhaps I was persuaded by his pathetic and embarrassing performance as a wrestler. But recently, I've become a fan of The Rock and feel he's becoming a quality actor. I was skeptical about this movie from the beginning but was surprised at how much I enjoyed it. I found myself laughing throughout. Not to mention it keeps making money at the box office.The movie is about a group of misfits in detention that stumble across a vintage video game system. When they set it up and begin to play they are sucked into the game actually becoming the individual characters of the game, complete with a number of lives, strengths and weaknesses. The film is convincing as an actual video game and gives video games styles appropriate credit. The action and visual effects are impressive and entertaining. Jack Black gives a convincing performance as a ditzy, popular, sexy blond that is addicted to her phone. Johnson seems to be the typical role as the strong hero with no weaknesses that seems to lead the team. Kevin Hart is his usual self as Fridge, a small whiney character in the game, a very different person than the football jock from the real world. (Assume that's where his name 'Fridge' comes from) He seems to have an insignificant role as Johnson's side kick, but quickly adapts, accepts and contributes. My favorite character was Martha, the nerdy girl that seems to see the world clearly with all its superficial and unimportant elements. She becomes a martial arts babe who has a sexy and rare ability for dance fighting. See the movie for more info, I don't want to spoil anything. Her performance is funny and entertaining. I love the way she kicks some tail and thinks through situations assisting the team. Because the film takes place in a video game setting some action is convincing and believable when in other movies it might appear ridiculous or far fetched. Flying a helicopter sideways for example. In a Mission Impossible movie it may force us to roll our eyes and mutter: "Seriously? Come on." It has the ability to exaggerate reality laws, much like the Matrix movies. I was a little disappointed with a few inappropriate and completely unnecessary sexual jokes and some romantic drama that was included in the story that didn't seem to fit. Some may appreciate it, but I felt the film could have done without it. Can I mention this? I know others are hesitant to address it. In every movie Johnson shows off his impressive chest tribal tattoo. Instead of seeing the character in the movie I see The Rock, playing that character. The Rock looks the exact same in every film he is in. Just like Baywatch, a post for another time, instead of Mitch Buchannon, I'm seeing Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson playing a lifeguard in a movie. The same goes for every other recent movie Johnson has been in. We all know his tattoo, and what it looks like. It's as if Johnson refuses to be anyone else, other than himself, for any movie. Fast and Furious? San Andreas? GI Joe? See where I'm going with this? Could we please have hair and makeup strive to show some effort in converting Johnson into the actual character in the film? Do I even need to add a reference to the character transformation of Gary Oldman for the film Darkest Hour here?I really do miss PG movies that are appropriate for all ages. They seem to be very rare now days. It would have been nice if a little bit of unnecessary content would have been filtered from this movie to give it the PG rating, so that kids could enjoy it as well.Overall the movie was a lot of fun. One I'd see again and recommend to others. I can see why it keeps making money at the box office.

title: The Vidiot Reviews...
text: Jumanji: Welcome to the JungleThe worst thing about life in a video game is the strippers only accept Bitcoin.Thankfully, the gamers in this adventure-comedy are miles from civilization.Four high school archetypes get detention and accidentally end up in the jungle-themed role-playing video game Jumanji. Trapped inside of mirror opposite avatars (Dwayne Johnson, Jack Black, Kevin Hart, Karen Gillan) of themselves, the incongruous crew sets out to save the jungle nation by returning a stolen gemstone to the jaguar god. Unfortunately their quest is continuously hindered, not only by their old idiosyncrasies, but also by their new personality's weaknesses and limited life span.Riffing on video games as well as adolescent stereotypes and fears, this VR update of the 1995 dice game original is surprisingly fresh and funny thanks to its talented cast and playful script.Yet without tiny game pieces to swallow you omit that game night tradition of visiting the ER. Green Lightvidiotreviews.blogspot.ca

title: Jumanji is not a video game!
text: It was very obvious from the trailer and beginning of the movie that Kevin Hart and Johnson would be the ones leading the film. But I think the very essence of Jumanji was destroyed. It was supposed to be a board game, not an RPG. There is no gathering resources, there is no "boss" or quests to be completed properly. The feminist agenda surrounding Gillan felt flat and unauthentic, falling into a lame copycat of Black Widow. And why Kasdan decided to go with Jack Black´s feminine/gay stereotype?. After all, it is just a good movie full of action and some boring jokes, but the whole "trapped in a videogame" genre has already burned out.

title: "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle"- Who'd have thought such an unnecessary and belated sequel could not only be good... but also be better than the original?
text: In the months leading up to the release of 2017's "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle", pretty much all you could hear was moans and groans from the collective film-going audience. People were upset that the beloved 1995 Robin Williams classic was getting a sequel. Purists were infuriated that the movie was updating the treacherous game for modern times. Online commentators couldn't get over co-star Karen Gillan's laughably skimpy outfit and took pot-shots at the movie over it. This is one of those films that just couldn't catch a break.Yet, something happened. Early reviews weren't just solid- they were absolutely glowing. A slew of sneak-preview screenings garnered extremely positive feedback from audiences. And when the film was finally released, it earned a near-unanimous acclaim. For a film that just couldn't catch a break, "Welcome to the Jungle" became a welcome and fantastic example of that old saying "never judge a book by its cover." Everyone was so wrapped up in pre-release drama and accusations... we just never considered that it might have not only been good- it might have actually been better than the original.Twenty years after the original adventure, a group of modern-day high school students all find themselves stuck in detention for varying reasons. Neurotic geek Spencer (Alex Wolff), meat-headed football star Anthony (Ser'Darius Blain), awkward loner Martha (Morgan Turner) and self-obsessed popular-girl Bethany (Madison Iseman). While sorting old magazines for recycling, the group discovers a mysterious video-game entitled "Jumanji" and boot it up, only to find themselves magically pulled inside of the game. Now occupying the bodies of the characters they chose (Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart, Karen Gillan and Jack Black), the troubled teenagers must complete the game's objective and solve increasingly difficult "levels" in order to escape. Along the way, they find a new ally in Alex (Nick Jonas), a long-lost kid who has been stuck in the game since 1996, all while being tracked by the game's villainous baddie Russell Van Pelt (Bobby Cannavale), whom has attained control over Jumanji's animal kingdom.The greatest treats of "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle" are the playful and creative tone the story takes, and the excellent cast who have a grand time hamming it up for the camera. Co-written by Chris McKenna of "Community" fame, the script is an absolute blast and a half that both pays tribute to the original film while also taking the story in interesting new directions. The idea of Jumanji transforming itself into a video-game to attract modern teenagers is actually really clever, and it keeps the sequel fresh and unique while still remaining true to the original. There's also a ton of really fun meta-humor that fans of modern games will absolutely adore. I really got a kick over how the secondary characters can only speak a few specific lines over and over, in a playful nod to how video-game NPC's usually only have a handful of programmed responses. And the uproariously funny fact that Gillan's aforementioned skimpy outfit is a satirical swipe at how games often objectify female characters. (Like I said... never judge a book by its cover...)This is aided quite well by director Jake Kasdan's keen eye for visuals and sharp sense of pacing. The film's action set-pieces are genuinely thrilling, the humor is well-delivered and there's almost never a dull moment to be had. Kasdan has honed his skills throughout the years with some delightful projects, including the woefully underrated "Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story", and here, that experience pays off in spades. And I can't wait to see what he does next.But perhaps the films greatest achievement is the absolutely outstanding cast. Particularly Johnson, Hart, Gillan and Black, who get to play against type and seem to relish in this in each and every moment. Everyone knows Johnson is one kick-butt dude... so it's a lot of fun seeing him playing the role of a neurotic teen whose allergic to just about everything. Gillan often plays sexy side-kicks or treacherous characters, which makes for a good contrast when she's playing an uncomfortable weirdo who can't talk to guys and doesn't like to be noticed. Hart's an absolute hoot playing a giant linebacker stuck in a diminutive body. And Jack Black... my god, Jack Black is outstanding as a popular teen girl stuck in a middle-aged man's body. He gets the biggest laughs of the film, and wisely never plays the part too broad. He's just perfect, perfect, perfect.It's a genuine surprise just how much fun this film is. I know as a 90's kid myself, I had my standards set high and thought nothing could come close to the original. And I was very pleasantly shocked when I walked out of the theater and realized that in many ways, "Welcome to the Jungle" is better than the original. It's sharp. Exciting. Hilarious. It really is the perfect continuation. Sure I could nit-pick the fact that the villainous Van Pelt is a bit under-developed. And I could argue that a few of the effects don't quite work. But on the whole... yeah. If you loved the original, I can't imagine you wouldn't love this stellar sequel just as much if not more.I'm giving "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle" an excellent 9 out of 10 for its sheer, infectious fun-factor. Definitely go in with an open mind and give it a shot. Because take it from me... no matter what pre-conceived notions you might have, it'll defy your expectations in the best of ways!

title: More Fun Than It Has Any Right To Be
text:
Upon seeing the trailer for this film, my initial reaction was "Oh, God, why?" I honestly probably wouldn't have seen this film (certainly not in theatres) had it not been for a family trip to the movies Christmas day. However, I must say I was pleasantly surprised.
Let me say that this is not a good movie, but neither is it a bad movie. It is ever so slightly above average as far as I am concerned. The plot is essentially "Breakfast Club" meets "Ready Player One" meets "Aguirre, the Wrath of God". Four mismatched kids are sent to detention, where they discover a videogame that sucks them into the Amazonian world of Jumanji. They must work together, braving the dangers of the jungle, to return an ostrich-egg-sized jewel with magical properties to the eye socket of a massive Jaguar idol before the villain, Van Pelt (Bobby Cannavale, "Ant-Man"), wraps his evil talons round it.
Jumanji is fast paced, light-hearted, humorous, and, above all, just a ton of fun. It is not anything that will win awards; it didn't break any new ground, it (probably) won't be remembered as a classic in fifteen years, but if you're looking for something fun, this movie might just put a smile on your face. Don't go in expecting to be blown away, but with managed expectations, this film is utterly enjoyable.

title: Entertaining and cringe written
text: I really wanted to like this movie because after seeing the cast on 'The Graham Norton Show' they seemed to click so good together and they were so funny. So funny I was laughing really heard. But about the movie. It starts off exactly where the first one left off which is pretty amazing and awesome but after that great scene then the movie just spirals down to another 5/10 hollywood crap-fest. Filled with cliche moments, forced laughter and such cringe worthy moments I just had to look up into the ceiling because it was really terrible at times. True the movie has it moments and it is funny at times but the main plot is nothing like the original which I saw last week and it still holds up and that is a 8/10 movie even though it has some lame jokes here and there. But it's a truly amazing movie. But when it comes to this one. Sure it is entertaining and The cast is great but the movie is so poorly written and I was sitting there expecting a twist or something cool to happen but it's really lame if you compare it to the first movie which was and still is an amazing movie. The intro and build up of Alan Parrish story which seems like a Stephen King inspired moment, how it is filmed and the style and yeah everything. But nope I really wanted to like this movie but I can't give more than 5/10 because of all the terrible, cliche, cringe and hollywood nonsense it brings with it. And yes it is even a very weak 5/10. Disappointed.

title: Jumanji(2017)-Movie Review
text:
Jumanji-Welcome to the Jungle tells the story about four teens who go into detention, they found an old Videogame called "Jumanji" and get stucked in it, there they have to surpass a series of obstacles to get back.
This is the new version of the very succesful movie from the 90´s.With that being said is not a remake, just to clarify.
Welcome to the Jungle has a twist, the teens get into the bodys of different characters, very different form them.It´s a twist that works, the comedy comes from there and also from the stregths and weaknesses of the characters in the game, which are well developed and inserted making the story go forward and making the movie funny. So, in that way the script is well developed even if it is different obstacles the characters have to pass.
The whole cast does a good job giving they´re one mannerisms into the characters in the game.
It is also worth talking about the entertainmment level, the movie never forgets to be fun, problably the biggest virtue of all.
Regarding the negative aspects of the movie, Bobby Cannavle plays an underappreciated generic villain, and there were moments were the CGI could have been improved.
Jumanji-Welcome to the jungle is a well developed movie, it´s fun, funny, thrilling and surprisingly touching by the end.7.1/10

title: I was shocked that I Loved this film
text: I was was very shocked that I loved the film "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle". I did not want to see this to begin with. I am not a fan of "Action/Adventure" or "Comic Book Movies". So I was shocked that I loved this movie. At the beginning I thought "Oh It's The Breakfast Club" stuck in a fantasy world.Now I will say "That is still partially true" but what this film is rarely hits a false note. It was lots of fun with a huge heart.Set twenty-one years after the first film, the plot follows four teenagers who are transported into the video game world of Jumanji, playing as the characters they chose. They must overcome the game's magical power in order to win and return home.If you are looking for a film to see (It hits DVD Soon) then make this your top choice.

title: One-Line Review: Jumanji 3 (7 Stars)
text: Jumanji 3 is a pleasantly fun film to watch with your friends and family and laugh out loud at the multiple jokes (dialog quips) that these funny characters throw at you while their very lives are at stake, the fact which led me reduce three stars from its rating. TN.

title: DJ would take any script he could get his hands on these days....
text: It's as though the characters were improvising their lines, making their words up as they go along. No actual thrill of adventure or danger with a story like this, it's as though the whole film was just a big set up for a laugh and that's it.The villain was not even a villain, played absolutely no role in the story whatsoever and played no threat to the main characters.Kevin Hart, again, being the scaredy cat of the cast and shouting his lines out to the audience as per usual, seems like the easiest job in the world today, although i have to say still the funniest (regardless of how forced the jokes were).Lost all respect for Jack Black taking this role on, then again it's not as if he's a big time actor anyway so this fits the bill for him.Karen was just eye candy because fan-boys demand it. thats all. This one was frustrating because its not the worst film I have seen but I would not look to this film for a laugh or enjoyment of any sort, it's just another project on DJ's CV, he's got his star on the walk of fame now, he can just hang up the towel now. To add, if you're going to create a character name for this guy, don't have it be the same first name he's already portrayed from Ballers, because if anyone watches that show, that's all they're gonna be thinking about when his name is mentioned.

title: You're in the jungle baby
text: When it comes to out-of-body humor, Jumanji proves there's still some magic in the bottle. The chemistry between the film's cast is so electric that an otherwise predictable adventure for kids turns into a fun romp for the whole audience.

title: Imaginative fun with gorgeous sets and effects
text: Spencer, a shy high schooler, gets sent to detention for writing a term paper for Fridge a star football player. Fridge goes along as does Martha & Bethany for other reasons. Once there, they are given menial tasks but find an old video game console with the game Jumanji. Before long, all four are pulled into the game but with different bodies. Spencer is big n strong while Fridge is short and whiny. Bethany is a man while Martha is a fit martial arts expert. The rules of the game soon emerge. They have 3 lives while playing the game; this is good as dangers surround them, including an evil leader and his tough biker gang. More importantly, they must work together to return a large emerald "eye" to a Jaguar statue way up a mountain. If they don't, they will never go back to their old lives. Can they do it? This imaginative and fun film has great stars, sets, storylines and special effects. Families will love watching such a cool adventure together.

title: Welcome to the Jungle, We got fun and games
text: JUMANJI Welcome to the Jungle is the second film adaptation of the book Jumanji and is a stand-alone sequel to the 1995 film Jumanji with Robin Williams. This version turns the magical board game into a magical video game transporting the players into the game itself. With that, it is a film about children in the bodies of adults (the adults being their in-game avatars), the adults being famous people. The famous people include Dwayne "The Rock'' Johnson (wrestler turned actor who appeared in films like Scorpion King, DC League of Super Pets, and Black Adam), Kevin Hart (comedian and actor who often co-stars with The Rock), Jack Black (actor who did roles in School of Rock, Tropic Thunder, and the Super Mario Bros Movie), and Karen Gillan (Nebula in the MCU). With that, it is pretty much a comedy, though the humor could have some mild cheesiness.It is way more of an action/adventure than Robin's version. It leans into the action even more that it is rated PG-13 rather than having the predecessor's PG rating. It also takes place in the jungle setting and the 1995 version has the jungle coming to the players' town and not them being brought to the jungle. I have watched the 1995 version before but it has been a little while since I had seen it but still, it seems hard to beat anything comical from Robin Williams.

title: Absolutely hilarious from start to finish!
text: When i first started watching this I thought I can't sit through two hours of these incredibily annoying teenagers, but then they changed into other characters when they got sucked into the game. I loved how they were all polar opposites of themselves in real life - the nerdy girl became a hot, high-kicking warrior, the nerdy guy became The Rock, the massive football player became the weedy side-kick and, in my opinion, the funniest of them all, the self-obsessed beauty queen became Jack Black! My jaw hurt from laughing so much at Jack Black playing a selfie-obsessed teenage girl! The adult actors were believeable in their portrayals of both their teenage characters and their characters in the Jumanji game. I'm always sceptical of these remakes of classic films but this one did not disappoint, thank you for not ruining the original!

title: Zathura much better than this
text: Aside for not even having enough of the game itself going on, it's not a decent children's film. So much perverted content cannot possibly be for decent viewers.

title: Perfect for the family
text: I was pleasantly surprised that this was such a great movie. It was action packed with some humor and drama mixed in. I loved the new take on this beloved classic. And although it is not the original, I loved it and more importantly my kids loved it. We have been watching it almost everyday, sometimes twice a day. When you're at home and the kids are on a break from school, this is the movie to watch.

title: A fun watch
text: I cannot believe so many people rated this with ten stars. Come on! That's not a movie that deserves such reviews! It was entertaining, and sometimes really funny. In general it could have turned out worse (I enjoyed the original film a lot and didn't expect much from a remake). Bottomline: It was an okay movie. But really, 10 stars and such high praise? Maybe the younger audience was impressed.

title: Wrong turn.
text: When I watched the original Jumanji I thought to myself, "You know what this film could use? Dudes with bulging muscles and women in skintight clothes baring their midriff." Oh wait, no I didn't.Hollywood needs to go back to focusing on storytelling, and stop putting all their money into eye candy and special effects. I would have much rather seen Robin Williams reprise his role from the original film (before he passed, obviously), and maybe even Kirsten Dunst. If that wasn't possible, or if the studio wasn't able to stay faithful to the original, then they should have left it alone. Sometimes it's worth it to let something become/remain a classic.In any other industry, if a company is no longer able to innovate or becomes stale, they go under. Clearly, Hollywood is out of ideas. They are constantly recycling and rebooting existing films and franchises, not all of which need it. Maybe we should start letting some of these studios fail.

title: Good but not great
text:
Jumanji was one of my childhood favorites. The older version, because of its originality, had a good mix of fun, excitement and visual treat. I watched the newer version anticipating it to be the better version of the original idea, but got disappointed. While Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is a good entertainment, it lacks the excitement and surprise factors that original movie presented. The plot begins in a very similar manner to the older version but instead of a board game, we see an electronic version of Jumanji. The movie progresses with the characters getting sucked in the game's reality to accomplish the challenge posed by the game's plot. Dwayne Johnson and Kevin Hart successfully carry the responsibility of entertaining the audience but the story-line doesn't allow the characters to be memorable. The movie contains a few scattered pieces of good entertainment that makes you laugh. Like the original version, new Jumanji carries many special effects and welcomes you to the Jungle as name suggests. But we are in the year 2017 - I expected a bit more from the visual effects.
Overall, it's a good entertainer but is just an incremental improvement from the original version.

title: What a pleasant surprise.
text:
I only saw this movie because the one I was going to see was sold out, so my expectations were not exactly high.
But, man, was I entertained by this.
Its a perfectly paced bit of fun, with jokes that actually land, combined with charm and quite a bit of heart.
The Rock may not be a great actor, but he saves it with utter charm, and Jack Black as a teenage girl could have gone wrong in so many ways, but it just works.
If I have a criticism, it has to be the main villain, who is just rather forgettable, but in a movie this charming and fun its a minor gripe.
Not a classic by any means, but a good time.

title: Hilarious
text: Movie was definitely refreshing. Sequel tends to do poorly, but this one pulled it off. The humour was fantastic. Chemistry between the Rock and Kevin Hart were flowing out of the screen. Perhaps if the storyline at the back was a little more developed, the show would have gotten 9. Why not 10? Cos no show is perfect! Jumanji is definitely tough to beat. Cant wait for the next one!

title: Great comedy and cast - Film review by Niall Maggs (http://ateenstakeonfilm.com)
text: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is a (apparent) sequel to the 1995 classic Jumanji starring Robin Williams, surrounding a mysterious board game. The 2017 film has the same premise, except this time it's not a board game, but a video game from the 90's.Four students at a school receive detentions for different reasons, and end up together having to staple booklets. Spencer (Alex Wolf) discovers an old video game called 'Jumanji', the students set up the game and play it, but end up being sucked in, turning them into the form of the characters they chose. Spencer's character takes the form of Dwayne Johnson. The other characters actors' consist of Karen Gillan, Kevin Hart, and Jack Black. From here onwards, there is non stop fun, action, great humour, and a glorious soundtrack!The premise here really works well. The plot takes unexpected twists and turns that keeps the audience on their toes. But what makes it thrive, is the great chemistry between the actors, in particular Dwayne Johnson and Kevin Hart; this type of chemistry can't be scripted. The one liners exchanged between both are hilarious and they work really well together. We'll definitely be seeing these two together in more movies in the future. It's not just these two that have great chemistry, Karen Gillan and Jack Black also really fit in with Johnson and Hart. All of them each have their own style and bring something different to the crew, Whether it's Johnson's charisma, Hart's comedy or Gillan's striking looks, there is something for everybody to enjoy in Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle.And trust me, Karen Gillan isn't just there for her beauty, she's hilarious and a vital asset to the rest of the team. All of her scenes are memorable, whether she's dancing to Big Mountain's Baby, I Love Your Way while beating soldiers up, or taking flirting advice from Jack Black, she's constantly the star among the popular likes of Dwayne Johnson, which demonstrates her strength as an actor if she can outdo The Rock! Her performance is brilliant, and the video game character is a complete opposite to the real life Martha, played by Morgan Turner. In real life she's shy, anxious and unpopular. However in the game she's a complete badass! The way the filmmakers handled each character is really great. The tough Spencer is a nerdy guy in real life. Completely different to Fridge (Kevin Hart) who is a strong, tough, popular football player, but in the game, he's quite cowardly, small and weak. This aspect I really liked.Henry Jackman's score is used really effectively. Every scene benefited with the heart pounding music. In particular, there is a lot of sequences where the tension and suspense is just incredible. The score also resembles the whole jungle premise, making the scenes feel real and not just seem like a movie set. The sound still stayed a reasonable volume and you can still hear the dialogue. In a lot of films, the booming sound is unpleasant, but in Jumanji the music is a great addition to the already-intense scenes.The action was almost non stop. You're on the edge of your seat constantly and there is a great supply of thrills. The action direction was also very good. The lack of shaky-cam worked well, and even when it was used, the scene wasn't ever jarring or jerking. The sequences stayed enjoyable and you CAN actually see what's going on. These types of scenes were also shot brilliantly and the cinematography was simple but effective.There were some instances where a couple of scenes went on for too long however, and the runtime could've been shortened by about fifteen minutes. The pace was also sometimes clunky and jumpy. It rushes the ending but spends too long on a couple of scenes in the second act. However, the majority of the film stays consistent and smooth.There is also a lack of character development, and there are no real arcs to follow. We don't see any of the characters change throughout except for the end scene, but there is no gradual shift of attitude toward each other, they just start off disliking each other one moment; then just start loving each other...The film also suffers from a painfully weak villain, who we learn very little about nor do we know why he's there in the first place. He isn't particularly fear inducing or scary, and is just a complete cruel idiot for no reason whatsoever. The climax is also rushed, underwhelming and a slight let-down.Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is great fun and the comedy is brilliant and clever. The actors are excellent and their perfect for their role; they're most definitely likeable! The action is great and so's the chemistry between the characters, but does suffer from typical action clichés, however in the end, Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is absolutely great!

title: I Don't Know if it's Jumanji, But it's Fun
text: While it has (very) little in common with the original family classic besides name and the clever way it evolves the game into the modern age, this ambitious reimagining works best as a paint-by-numbers adventure. It's distractingly entertaining enough, formulaic with familiar story-telling stepping stones of development but its likable cast and clever use of scenario comedy makes it surprisingly enjoyable.

title: Great !
text: Plain great. A little over-action, but Rock rocks in the movie.The video game storyline did good.

title: Digging up our childhood to spit on it.
text: This movie is possibly one of the worst remakes I've seen in a while. The lack of humor is mind boggling and the acting and script was painful at best. In the end it's really just a cash grab that targets the younger audience with nostalgia and pop culture and it fails to deliver anything worth while.

title: The game has evolved...
text: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle, is surprisingly good reboot considering the original Jumanji is a classic. The film is funny, new, and full of action and adventure. Though the movie had its downs, the actors were good especially the teens. Juamanji: Welcome to the Jungle is great for families and will make anybody laugh. For me the movie was okay but worth it. Especially if your into people such as the Rock or Jack Black it's a definite go!"A game for those who seek to find a way to leave their world behind: Jumanji......"-Spencer, Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle

title: Better than the original
text: This movie will have you laughing but at times also on the edge of your seat. In my opinion, a great take on the concept of the original, starring Robin Williams, with twists and turns and comic relief that create a very enjoyable experience. It out did the original by a long stretch and Jack Black's performance was utterly hilarious.

title: Jumanji
text: It was a good funny film jack black was very funny

title: **Let's be clear: NOT a reboot!**
text:
My daughter and I love this movie. Excellent cast, funny script, great action sequences. Double thumbs up!
But this is not a reboot. It's a sequel.

title: Decent enough
text: Quite entertaining movie.Usual special effects are realistic enough. A decent family film, best actor in it was Karen Gillan.

title: Great fun
text: Don't understand the naysayers. This was an enjoyable romp that doesn't need to be compared to the original - they are both good in their own ways. Jack Black is superb and has the character down to a 't'. Well worth an hour or two of anybody's time.

title: Good not great but hot actress
text: This is a good self aware movie about teens pushed out of their comfort zone and becoming better people, etc... Good dialogue and well paced plot. However, it had a whole different dimension due to Karen Gillan, who is really hot but not hopeless in her role..

title: LOVE IT!
text: Me and my daughter watch this movie once a week to just laugh. The Rock (yes, he will always be The Rock to me!) is so dead-on! I was never a fan of Kevin Hart but in the movie, he is hilarious! Of course Jack Black is Jack Black. Even the girl character fits in just right. The only weak link was Nick Jonas, he was just bland, but the chemistry among all the actors was amazing! I hope the sequel is just as good! The Rock is the best!

title: Brainless fun.
text: Sometimes you need a film devoid of any modern politics and this Jumanji spin-off stays the shallow side of all that's toxic in Hollywoodland.

title: You know whats going on
text: Sure. I really like Jack Black for the most part and Karen Gillan is really cute and all but they dont lift the movie in that way.This movie, it seems, tries alot to be funny in a good and kind way. That's maybe why it doesn't work out. This film is not made for me and I believe I like more raw humour.Watch if you have nothing better to do at the moment. Otherwise. Please dont.

title: Less cheese please
text: It's a good family film and it is well made however it is overrated and not as funny as it should be. It's also really cheesy. The CGI wasn't good either and the bad guy was terrible.

title: Enjoyable
text: Jumanji was a entertaining flick. It serves the purpose of the cinema sometimes when one wants to sit back and enjoy some easy to understand film. The actors give decent performances and the film has some nice moments in them. Recommended for a nice night at the movies. 7/10

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: I really thought this movie would suck. I thought it was a reboot, which I usually don't care for but it's more of a sequel. And like reboots, sequels also often suck but this one doesn't. Not only is it very funny but I thought the acting was pretty good as well; this time Jumanji is a console game and the main characters get pulled into the game and get the body of the avatar they chose but they still have their original personality which doesn't always match the persona of the avatar. So as an actor you have to do a credible impersonation of a fictional personality in the body of another fictional personality. I also liked the fact that they really managed to incorporate a lot of console game features into the movie so it really feels like they are in a game; each player has 3 lives and different strengths and weaknesses, there's a map of the level and the game characters actually resemble those of a real console game. I also loved the fact that put Jack Black in the movie because that guy rocks.

title: Maybe I Need To Take A Break Of Adventure Movies
text: This film was unexpected for the most part. A Jumanji comedy sequal WHAT. But this movie was actually pretty good in my opinion Very funny. Some great action from all game palyers. To be honest I don't understand the hate at all maybe I just need to stay away from adventure movies. 7/10 Pretty Good

title: Fun, fun, fun
text:
In 1995, the movie Jumanji came to screens, starring the great Robin Williams and Kirsten Dunst.
The same idea, but then the whole game actually took place in the world of the children who played the game.
And it was an amazing movie.This film is completely different, more "technological" .
I enjoyed this movie very much, just as amazing as the original movie.Jack Black and Kevin Hart, two amazing actors, each time making me laugh again.
There's nothing to talk about Dwayne Johnson ... and Karen Gillan .... amazing.A film that can be summed up in one word: FUN

title: The McDonalds of film. Enjoyable, tasty and perfect for a hangover.
text: A light-hearted feel good film with plenty of cheesey jokes to fulfill the stereotype. If you appreciate this film for what it really is when it's great. It's non-comparable to the original, as this isn't a serious film, it's a comedy. The actors were picked perfectly, and each personality complimented each other. Thoroughly enjoyed it.

title: The New Standard for Adventure Films
text: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is technically a sequel, but is perfectly capable of standing alone as one of the most effectively paced, smartly written, and conceptually engrossing adventure films released in recent years. The actors that play the four main characters have fantastic chemistry and impressive comedic timing. Each of them were given a difficult task of playing against type, excluding Kevin Hart who virtually plays the same character you've seen him as in countless other movies. As far as supporting actors go, Bobby Cannavale clearly had a good time playing the villain. The jungle setting provides beautiful scenery, and Kasdan uses CGI relatively sparingly, but rather effectively. The dialogue was hysterically witty, and the fight scenes were well choreographed. The only time the film seemed to drag was in the first twenty minutes before they had entered the game. Regardless, that's a somewhat minute problem for a film that more than makes up for the slow setup in the ensuing ninety minutes.

title: Fun but relatively bland
text: There's a lot to like about this film. The cast are largely playing against type; the interplay between the characters is fun; the set pieces are inventive and silly. However, this movie is predictable with a very linear plot and only moments of jeopardy for the characters. Any situation they find themselves in, they immediately dig themselves out of, and we kind of know what's going to happen before they do.The introduction to the real-life version of the characters, before the Jumanji-world scenes is long and drawn out, most likely a misguided attempt to make us appreciate the resolution of their character journeys, which is predictable and superficial.It's hard to know who this is really aimed at, with a blend of teen humour and simplistic kids' movie action.That said, it romps along, has plenty of action and CGI that looks like CGI, but you don't really care, and gives a modern twist to the original Jumanji concept.

title: skip the first 17 minutes
text: Suuuuper cringy intro for a movie. Generic over the top bad acting teenage intro to Jumani. If you can get past it (I skipped on Netflix) it's a good movie.

title: Not a reboot or a retelling of a classic
text: I can honestly tell you that this is a very good film It's not a reboot or a retelling of a classic It's definitely Is A continuation of the franchise If you like the original one then you will like this Film.

title: I was worried but I didn't need to be
text:
When I first heard that a sequel to Jumanji was being made I was terrified. The original to me is a true cinema classic but this one has done the job of complementing it so well.
Funny and clever for all the family. Definitely give this one a watch

title: A fun watch for the family
text: This movie contains an interesting and fun plot with characters that most kids will understand and at the very least find amusing. Dwayne Johnson's towering physique paired with Kevin Hart's towering comedic value make a great pair in this movie and keep the viewer laughing while the fast paced action keeps them on the edge of their seat. While it may not warrant watching more than once, Jumanji serves as a very entertaining and very funny adventure for the likes of a family hoping to laugh and not get bored.

title: An EXCELLENT film. Absolutely nails everything and ties to the original
text: This movie is a masterpiece. It feels like a classic and respects the source material of the original. A brilliant movie with a superb script and character development. Purely exceptional 👏

title: Nice
text: Nice movie. Entertaining also. Rock and black are awesome

title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle surprisingly exceeds the original and all expectations as one of the best, funniest, and most entertaining sequels of all time.
text: The sequel no one saw coming or expected to light up the box office as it did! Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is a fun adventure film with hilarious characters that works in every way. I will be honest; I was not a fan of the original movie - it freaked me out as a child. But the new film minimized the horror elements of Jumanji and focused more on adventure and humor. This time instead of a board game, Jumanji has morphed into a video game that sucks its unsuspecting victims into its deadly world. Welcome to the Jungle leans into all the video game tropes with hilarious results with jokes about skills, lives, NPCs, boss battles, and more. The movie is at its best with all the humor surrounding the body-swapped teens dealing with the game's characters they now inhabit - the skinny nerd becoming the muscular hero, the jock becoming a tiny sidekick, and the funniest of all, the pretty popular girl becoming Jack Black (who is the real stand out of the film). Jumanji is a must-see family adventure film that brings fun and laughs to everyone who dares to play the game.

title: Fun ride!!
text: 4 teens (a jock, a prep, and both a male and female nerd) get detention and stumble upon this odd video game titled - Jumanji,, and they get sucked into the game,, the jungle world of Jumanji!! The male nerd becomes a hulking alpha male / the jock becomes a little guy who carries a backpack / the preppy girl becomes a middle aged, fat professor guy / and the female nerd becomes gorgeous, dancing fighter. Their mission is to restore a magical stone to the eye of a jaguar statue, and save Jumanji!Johnson, Gillian, Hart, and Black are an incredible comedic team (Jonas also joins them at some point along the journey).

title: Fun movie
text:
Saw the original movie with Robin Williams which was loads of fun.
"Welcome to the Jungle" is just as enjoyable with all the cast putting out great performances.
Worth watching!

title: Don't think of it as Jumanji. Enjoy it for what it is
text: Absolutely awful script in my opinion sorry. This was in no way as enjoyable or original as the first and only Jumanji movie.However the score is only for the idea and the writing. The acting was spot on, the comedy from Jack , Dwayne and Kevin was spot on, pretty ladies few action scenes . It's worth a watch but won't remember it.

title: Good fun
text: Four high school teens are transported into Jumanji, a video game. They now have new bodies, all complete with unique strengths and weaknesses. They also have a mission - retrieve a previous gem from an evil warlord and return it to the statue it came from. Unless they do this, they'll never leave the game.Good fun. Fairly original - real life people being transported into a video game, and ending up as video game characters with abilities and weaknesses and a certain number of lives. The video game setting works well and the plot is quite seamlessly developed from this premise. The disparities between the real lives of the people and their in-game characters makes for some very interesting and often amusing scenes. Very funny at times.Good action scenes and CGI too.Entertaining.

title: Great production
text: Lots of great effects. The story is your typical jungle adventure with some troubles added. Funny to see grown ups talking like kids also. Definitely an undertone of home-sexuality here and there, though. Good thing they had one sexy one to compensate.

title: Big pictures, low story
text: Technically well done movie, funny cast, but the story is random and boring af.

title: Welcome to Jumanji
text: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle, is the #1 Movie in America. It's a game for those who seek to find a way to leave the world behind. That's right Jumanji fans, Jumanji is back, and better than ever. Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart, Karen Gillan, and Jack Black are the perfect cast for the movie to have all the fun, for the whole Jumanji fans to enjoy.

title: A Hilarious, Adventure-Packed Story
text: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is a hilarious family movie that captures its audience through its epic tale. The movie is funny in ways that allow it to relate to most audiences. The new Jumanji follows the traditional story set in a newer setting, and instead of Jumanji being a board game, it is instead a video game. The film is set up so well that it does not feel like another copy of Jumanji, but instead its own original plot. The cast is paired so well, the movie is easy to stay interested in their hilarious connection that keeps its audience laughing. The cast accurately captures their roles as high school students from many social stances. The movie's various theatrical elements also add to the vibrant setting of the movie keeping its audience on the edge of their seats. Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is all around a must-see, adventure packed story.

title: Modern Interpretation of a Childhood Classic
text:
I was sceptically excited and scared upon the announcement of this sequel since the original movie has always been close to my heart and was a fond part of my childhood.Going in, I wasn't quite sure how "Welcome to the Jungle" was going to tie itself into the universe and if I would like the new direction. It could've easily been an awful disaster, but I am happy to say that I thoroughly enjoyed this modern interpretation of Jumanji.
This movie knows exactly what it is and doesn't take itself too seriously, has good pacing and the perfect balance of action to character development. I was also surprised to see the amount of attention to detail, every plot is resolved by the end of the movie along with a majority of questions that you could ask. I thought the concept of the characters was interesting and unique and was utilized very well.Additionally, if you've spent the past 22 years wondering what happened at the beach after the credits of Jumanji rolled, worry not, you will get your answer.This sequel/spiritual successor has the perfect amount of nods and tie-in's into the original lore and handles that mission just as good as Jurassic World.Overall a good action adventure story with a moral purpose and a core message.This is a fun pop-corn filled roller-coaster ride for any age. It's the kind of movie that you can join mid-way while flipping through the channels and stay tuned until the end. It doesn't quite have the magic of the original but maybe that's just because I'm getting old or maybe it's because the one and only Robin Williams isn't with us anymore.You definitely can't go wrong with this one so feel free to take your kids/girlfriend/family to go see it. I promise you that you won't hate it as much as Star Wars (but that's a review for next week).I give "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle" a solid 7.5 out of 10.P/S 
The original Jumanji is actually criminally under-rated and somehow holds a minuscule 50% on Rotten Tomatoes.

title: Old school fun and adventure

title: my loved Jumanji
text:
I really enjoyed this movie.I went in with mixed feelings and the fear that this would be a typical horrible Hollywood remake, well it wasn't.
I love this story and I was really looking forward to the remake.
With all of today's technology and the real life location shots, I was expecting spectacular. What I got was a dud.
This film is beautiful. The scenes, the gloom, the wastelands are all very well done.
As a fan of Jumanji. This is the best movie I've seen the year of 2017. I enjoyed it immensely and will absolutely watch it again.

title: Someone tell Hollywood to get original
text: You know I feel like not enough people say this so looks like it is up to me, Hollywood needs to get original. I have personally watched a lot of the movies coming out recently and while sitting through this one it occurred to me that most of the are just remakes or sequels. why do people even go see these I mean went twice but that's because I take my reviews very seriously and look for minor details. The average person shouldn't be going around watching movies which have no original ideas, I mean you look at something like suicide squad, a great movie btw, and you realize that nothing like that has never been done before. I mean everything about it was original and compared to jumango, or what ever the name for this movie is, you realize that it is just a movie trying to be funny by reusing every joke ever heard. Overall the acting was sub par the worst by far being Jack Black. I had high hopes for him after his performance in Goose Bumps but man he really feel apart i guess. When it comes down to it I would say that if you do see this movie try to sneak in to as to avoid giving another unoriginal movie money.

title: "Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle" Comes Ready to Play
text: Remaking, rebooting or making a sequel to any 90's family film is almost always deemed sacrilegious. While we have seen some really bad films come from that, we've yet to really see one that put in the time and effort to make it worth while. Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle tries to step into the ring and surprisingly keeps a great level of energy even most comedies this year haven't been able to achieve.The film takes place in modern day as Jumanji the board game has evolved into a shape of a Atari like cartridge console and is discovered by 4 high school students while in detention. The teenagers decide to start the game as a time passer, and soon realize they get sucked into the video game and become the characters they have chosen. So in order to get out the game, they have to take the jewel to a high mountain and not lose all 3 of their lives in the process.Jumanji takes alot of elements from video game nature, even down to how NPC's (non-playable characters) operate and still able to get the viewer up to speed even if you don't play video games. The film also has a great kinetic energy when it gets into the game mode and never really loses steam. The chemistry between the leads are all really solid, specifically Jack Black playing as the self-centered teenage girl who is even funnier than I would have expected him to be in this kind of role. And for Dwayne Johnson, he's able to carry the uncertain nerd characteristic well, and if you watched him as The Rock during his wrestling days, it makes his "Smoldering Intensity" moments that much funnier.As for any setbacks, the villain as about as memorable as any other video game villain. He doesn't have any interesting backstory and doesn't give the characters much of a challenge either. Also while all the other characters are able to play their counterparts well, Kevin Hart feels like he is playing Kevin Hart, despite his teenage character not sharing that similarity.In many ways, Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle is a studio mandated cash-in on a familiar property, but at the same time, is able to have fun with itself. The energy is the right mix of dumb and fun, even at the same time and it's able to be a better video game adaptation than a lot of the one's we've gotten in recent history. This might not be a film remembered 10-20 years from now, but it will definitely suck you in as soon as you press Start.

title: Good fun, if a little forgettable
text: This is my first review on here. Now normally people reserve their first review to make sweeping negative statements on films they've just seen, or to rave about something while it's still fresh in their head and they're still full of that post-cinema buzz.This review is neither, and is more for me to make some honest remarks about a film I enjoyed, but later found it to have to unnecessary criticisms on these pages.I am no "critique" and when I go to see such films, I appreciate that a little bit of your brain should be switched off in order to just enjoy these films for what they are. You shouldn't be expecting Oscar performances, or epic twists etc. if you are expecting that, you shouldn't waste your time with these types of films. Why go see this film at all if that is your mindset? You do kind of know what you're getting yourself in to right?Secondly, while this film shares it's name with the original, I wouldn't put it down as a remake, rather, it's much more of a modern interpretation/adaptation. So I wouldn't really compare the old and new films directly - although people will continue to do so.So with the above in mind, this IS a good fun, action/comedy film that I think all of the family would enjoy. What I will say is that some of the humour was a bit flat and forgetful and that the general pacing was too fast. The way each character discovered their abilities for example was lame and really felt like it hadn't been given much thought. Considering this was, for myself at least, one of the main attractions of a modern Jumanji made out to be like a video game, this was a massive opportunity wasted and would have really clicked with the more nerdy members of the audience, such as myself, had they just given this area more thought. The ending was a bit cheesy, even for the cheesiest of folk, although I have to admit it did give me that happy warm feeling you sometimes get, so I won't complain too much.If you want a classic 2 hours of popcorn busting fun which doesn't have to be taken seriously at all - go and give it a watch.

title: Strong middle part
text: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle has a strong middle part, which is the part where the characters really start interacting with one another and start working off of the good chemistry between them. The writing is mostly good and the actors are good, though this movie is really a Jack Black show. The guy completely steals the show, playing a superficial girl stuck inside a guy's body, which may be a little too silly to some.The action sequences and the physics throughout the movie do not make a whole lot of sense, but the movie of course always has the excuse that the whole thing is a game and is not supposed to make too much sense.The weak parts of the film are the beginning and the end, but especially the beginning, where the movie rushes through the introductions without any impact, in order to get to the main part as fast as possible. If you are watching the movie with other people, it may be easy to get distracted and talk during the very beginning and thus miss a few things.This movie is unlikely to occupy your mind long after you have seen it, but it is still a lot of fun.
